description:
As a child, Thorfinn sat at the feet of the great Leif Ericson and thrilled to wild tales of a land far to the west. But his youthful fantasies were shattered by a mercenary raid. Raised by the Vikings who murdered his father, Thorfinn became a terrifying warrior, forever seeking to kill the band's leader, Askeladd, and avenge his father. Sustaining Thorfinn through his ordeal are his pride in his family and his dreams of a fertile westward land, a land without war or slavery … the land Leif called Vinland.

(Source: Kodansha USA)

Notes:
- Won the Grand Prize at the Japan Media Arts Festival in 2009.
- Winner of the 36th Kodansha Manga Award in the General category in 2012.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Vikings
tags.description: Prominently features Scandinavian seafaring pirates and warriors.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Slavery
tags.description: Prominently features slaves, slavery, or slave trade.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Ships
tags.description: Prominently features the use of sea-based transportation vessels.

tags.name: Parenthood
tags.description: Centers around the experience of raising a child.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Pirates
tags.description: Prominently features sea-faring adventurers branded as criminals by the law.

tags.name: Agriculture
tags.description: Prominently features agriculture practices.

tags.name: Environmental
tags.description: Concern with the state of the natural world and how humans interact with it.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Language Barrier
tags.description: A barrier to communication between people who are unable to speak a common language.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Wilderness
tags.description: Predominantly features a location with little to no human activity, such as a deserted island, a jungle, or a snowy mountain range.

tags.name: Indigenous Cultures
tags.description: Prominently features real-life indigenous cultures.

tags.name: Class Struggle
tags.description: Contains conflict born between the different social classes. Generally between an dominant elite and a suffering oppressed group.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/makotoyukimura)

Before writing his own manga he started out as an assistant to Shin Morimura. He debuted in 2000 with Planetes, which was adapted to a 26-episode anime. He is currently working on Vinland Saga which began serialization in Weekly Shounen Magazine, and later on continued serialization in Afternoon.

He has won the 2009 Japan Media Arts Festival Grand Prize for Vinland Saga.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/marcbernabe) |  [Official Website](https://www.japonesenvinetas.com)

He is a translator and interpreter of Japanese, with special emphasis on the translation of manga and anime, a field in which he has a background of hundreds of volumes and episodes translated. In addition, he's a  specialist in didactics of the Japanese language and culture for Spanish speakers. He also has published many books about Japan and Asia.

He is famous for appearing in a Shin-chan's episode where the family goes to Spain.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Angilram) | [Official Website](http://www.xavieredaumarie.com/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/xavieredaumarie/) | [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/xaviere-daumarie-747916207/) | [Behance](https://www.behance.net/xaviere)

Xavière Daumarie is an illustrator and a comic book artist with a passionate love for fairytales, historical fashion, and weird characters. She has created cover and interior illustrations for adult and middle-grade books, graphic novels, comics and characters, creature and prop designs for book series. 

She’s a polyglot, speaks French, English, is a professional Japanese manga translator and is currently learning Korean. 

In 2018, she was nominated for a Spectrum Award in the comics category.

[Official Website](http://einfachjapanisch.de) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@Hiro) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/1fachJapanisch) | [Threads](https://www.threads.net/@einfachjapanisch) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/einfachjapanisch) | [Twitch](https://www.twitch.tv/einfachjapanisch) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@einfachjapanisch)

Not to be confused with the animator of the [same name](https://anilist.co/staff/158898/Hirofumi-Yamada).
